review: I love this little thing.  We ended up canceling our cable, because cable is getting too expensive and given the projection from the Comcast/Time Warner merger - this was a good alternative to spending approximately 200 dollars a month on cable.  My wife and I are extremely happy with this product.  Amazon always seems to be amazing us with their products.  I strongly recommend this product to anyone looking for an alternative to cable or just really enjoys reliable and high definition(close to Blu-ray, if not Blu-ray) video.
author: Timothy Ward

review: Way more positive than negative with this. Granted, I'm coming over from the Netgear unit which, in terms of speed, is like going from dial-up internet to cable. Seriously, it's THAT much of a difference. The jury's still out as far as Prime is concerned but one of the weird gripes comes from Amazon Instant Video. Since it's not with the unit itself, I didn't dock a star but why haven't they implemented an auto-queue feature like Hulu and Netflix use? Not that I'm THAT lazy but it is nice not having to push forward then then enter EVERY TIME you want to move to the next episode of a show.***Important note*** Pay attention to the specifications for HDMI. I used a first generation cable and had all sorts of issues. Hulu and Netflix will either not work at all or give you various playback errors that gave me all sorts of frustration setting this up. Once I changed cables out, I was flying. It's in the instructions but....who reads those?!
